intro: Callitris commersonii, commonly known as the white cypress-pine, is a coniferous tree native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae and is characterized by its slender, tall trunk and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant has scale-like leaves that are tightly packed along the branches, giving it a compact appearance. It produces small, cone-like structures that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of Australian woodlands and forests.
